contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=March 2008}} '''George Seddon''' (1727â€“1801) was an English [[Cabinet making|cabinetmaker]]. At one time his furniture making business was the largest and most successful in [[London]], employing over four hundred craftsmen. He was Master of the [[Worshipful Company of Joiners and Ceilers|Joiners Company]] of London in 1795. ==References== *[http://www.barbicanliving.co.uk/Blocks/seddon_4.html The life of George Seddon] {{Authority control|VIAF=96551873}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Seddon, George | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = British cabinetmaker | DATE OF BIRTH = 1727 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1801 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Seddon, George}} [[Category:1727 births]] [[Category:1801 deaths]] [[Category:British furniture designers]] {{furniture-stub}}
